page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY I
page.content: Much of the local history is tied up with 1. Cambusnethan Parish & 2. Coltness Estate 1. The area occupies a part of Cambusnethan Parish. There has been a church in area since 1649{(GR.807554) (relacing a 12th Century one moved here from outside the area). 1837 this building was declared "ruinous and dangerous" and replaced by another to the west across the road{(GR.806554) Cambusnethan Old Parish Church. Both churches were endowed by the local landowners, firstly the Stewarts of Coltness and after 1839 the Holdworth family who bought the estate. Still standing today are the ruins of the original church and graveyard (famous- Guiness Book of Records, grave of the largest baby in the world).
